results.firPara: The forward insists its not about me, its about the team as he and Englands striker-heavy squad prepare for the start of Euro 2016 in France
results.secPara: The forward insists its not about me, its about the team as he and Englands striker-heavy squad prepare for the start of Euro 2016 in France
results.webTitle: England can't win Euro 2016 if there are egos, says Daniel Sturridge

results.firPara: A postman and non‑league player during Euro 2012; a Northern Ireland international at Euro 2016. I dont pinch myself some of the time, Conor Washington says. I pinch myself all the time. And he feels indebted to Jamie Vardy when reality dawns.
results.secPara: In the summer when Spain made it a hat-trick of tournament triumphs and Leicester City broke the transfer record for a non-league player to sign Vardy from Fleetwood Town, the Queens Park Rangers forward combined postal rounds with prolific performances for St Ives Town in the Southern Football League. Washingtons previous employment has been well documented – the tag will stick with me but its not the worst one to have, he says – but less so his admiration for those in the vanguard of changing British footballs misconceptions about the talent lurking in the lower divisions. Vardy and company are partly responsible, the striker believes, for ensuring he became a professional footballer rather than a weapons systems operator for the RAF.Maybe I didnt have the rub of the green when I was younger to get into an academy, but I appreciate the way its happened for me and I think thats happening more and more now; people respect lower league quality that bit more, he says.
results.webTitle: Northern Ireland’s former postman Conor Washington determined to deliver in France

results.firPara: Chris Coleman has admitted there is no chance of Joe Allen, Joe Ledley and Hal Robson-Kanu all starting in Waless opening Euro 2016 group game against Slovakia on Saturday. The three players have been carrying injuries and the Wales manager said that it would be reckless to name the trio in his first XI when they are in a race to prove their fitness.
results.secPara: It seems almost certain that Allen, who has had a knee problem, will line up against Slovakia, but Ledley and Robson-Kanu may have to start on the bench. Coleman admitted that Ledley, who has not played since breaking a leg on 7 May, would be unable to complete 90 minutes.
results.webTitle: Wales will not gamble with all three injuries from start against Slovakia

results.firPara: Ronald Koeman is expected to be appointed Evertons new manager within 48 hours after Southampton accepted a compensation package worth around £5m for the Dutch coach and members of his backroom staff.
results.secPara: Farhad Moshiri, Evertons major shareholder, identified Koeman as his leading candidate to succeed Roberto Martínez after deciding to end the Catalans three-year tenure before the end of last season. The determination to prise Koeman from St Marys has led to the British-Iranian billionaire meeting Southamptons demands after several days of negotiations.
results.webTitle: Everton land Ronald Koeman after £5m fee is agreed with Southampton

results.firPara: José Mourinho is on the verge of making his first signing at Old Trafford after the Villarreal defender Eric Bailly underwent a medical at Manchester United.
results.secPara: The clubs have agreed a fee of around £25m plus add-ons for Bailly, who can play across the back four and looks to have the physical prowess to prosper in the Premier League. Mourinho saw his priority as strengthening the defence and Bailly quickly became his primary target, nothwithstanding the overtures to Zlatan Ibrahimovic. The United manager has seen enough to believe Bailly can be a long‑term centre-half for United and has seen off a host of interested clubs for the Ivory Coast international.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho set to make Eric Bailly his first Manchester United signing

results.firPara: As colourful characters go, Owain Fôn Williams takes some beating. This is a man who sat on the substitutes bench for six years before making his Wales debut, strums the guitar for everyone to sing along to at the team hotel, and plans to open an art exhibition with his own oil paintings when he returns from the European Championship finals in France.
results.secPara: Humble and talented, it is easy to see why the Inverness Caledonian Thistle goalkeeper is such a popular figure in the Wales squad. Gareth Bale has warmed to his renditions of Johnny Cash songs – there was a lovely scene in Haifa after victory over Israel during qualifying – and Wayne Hennessey, the Wales No1, has commissioned a piece of art that strays slightly away from the slate-mining theme of Williams current work.
results.webTitle: Owain Fôn Williams paints picture of harmony in Wales Euro 2016 squad

results.firPara: Francesco Totti has agreed a new one-year contract with Roma. Totti met the club president, James Pallotta, on Tuesday and the 39-year-old has now confirmed that he will play on into a 25th season in the Italian capital.
results.secPara: I really wanted this contract, it represents the realisation of my dream, said Totti, who will turn 40 on 27 September. I always wanted to end my career having only worn one shirt – the Roma one.
results.webTitle: Francesco Totti signs new one-year contract with Roma

results.firPara: Italy have announced that Giampiero Ventura will succeed Antonio Conte as their head coach after the forthcoming European Championship in France.
results.secPara: Venturas tenure at Torino was brought to an end by mutual consent on 25 May, after five years at the club, and the national job will be his 21st since his first move into management in 1976 with the Sampdoria youth team.
results.webTitle: Italy announce Giampiero Ventura as next head coach

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Englands Euros countdown, a settlement, and Dulwich Hamlet
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Englands Euros countdown, a settlement, and Dulwich Hamlet
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Some unspecified but no doubt bantertastic forfeit

results.firPara: Carneiro also agrees to drop claim of sex discrimination and harassment against former Chelsea manager José Mourinho
results.secPara: The former Chelsea team doctor Eva Carneiro has settled her claim of constructive dismissal, minutes before she was due to give testimony that was expected to be highly damaging.
results.webTitle: Eva Carneiro settles constructive dismissal claim with Chelsea
